column2:
Title: Summary comparison - correctness policy

Objective
Evaluate which summary includes less false information.

Instructions
You are given 2 summaries (A, B) created from a reference text. Evaluate which summary includes less false information.

Scoring Criteria
A significantly better than B (Score: -2)
A slightly better than B (Score: -1)
Neither A or B is better than the other (Score: 0)
B slightly better than A (Score: 1)
B significantly better than A (Score 2)
column3:
Title: Summary comparison - accuracy policy

Objective
Evaluate which summary accurately reflects the information from the reference text.

Instructions
You are given 2 summaries (A, B) created from a reference text. Evaluate which summary accurately reflects the information from the reference text.

Scoring Criteria
A significantly better than B (Score: -2)
A slightly better than B (Score: -1)
Neither A or B is better than the other (Score: 0)
B slightly better than A (Score: 1)
B significantly better than A (Score 2)

Note: Assess the accuracy of the information in the summaries based on their alignment with the details and context provided in the reference text. Consider the presence of accurate information, absence of false details, and faithful representation of the original content. If the reference text does not contain specific details or comparisons that would allow for a clear determination of which summary is more accurate, please indicate so in your evaluation.

Ensure that the scoring reflects the accuracy of the information in the summaries rather than the presence of false information.
